title: Wales Grand Adventure Tour
tagline: Seven days covering the best of Wales
suitableFor: Active individuals, couples, or families who enjoy outdoor adventures and are reasonably fit. Perfect for those who want a mix of thrilling activities and scenic exploration.
notSuitableFor: Those with significant mobility issues or a strong aversion to outdoor activities. Very young children may struggle with some of the hikes.
packingEssentials: Hiking boots with good ankle support
Map and compass/GPS device (or phone with offline maps)

stops.title: Velocity 2 Zip Line
stops.description: Experience the thrill of flying over Penrhyn Quarry on the world's fastest zip line, reaching speeds of over 100 mph.

wetAlt.title: Bounce Below
wetAlt.description: Jump and explore giant trampolines in a former slate mine at Zip World Llechwedd.

budgetAlt.title: Llyn Ogwen Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around Llyn Ogwen, a beautiful lake in Snowdonia National Park.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary mountaineering cafe in Llanberis, serving hearty portions and proper brews.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Padarn
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own lunch while overlooking the beautiful Llyn Padarn.

stops.title: Snowdon Summit Hike
stops.description: Hike to the summit of Snowdon, the highest mountain in Wales, via the Llanberis Path. Enjoy panoramic views (weather permitting!).

wetAlt.title: National Slate Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of the Welsh slate industry at this fascinating museum in Llanberis.

budgetAlt.title: Llanberis Lake Railway
budgetAlt.description: Take a scenic train ride along the shores of Llyn Padarn.

stops.title: YHA Snowdon Llanberis
stops.description: A comfortable and well-located hostel in Llanberis, perfect for hikers.

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan) - Camping
budgetAlt.description: Camping option near Llanberis, offering stunning views and basic facilities.

stops.title: White Water Rafting
stops.description: Experience the thrill of white water rafting on the River Tryweryn at the National White Water Centre.

wetAlt.title: Indoor Climbing Session
wetAlt.description: Enjoy an indoor climbing session at a local climbing centre in Bala.

budgetAlt.title: Walk Around Bala Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk around Bala Lake, Wales' largest natural lake.

stops.title: Plassey Caravan Park Restaurant
stops.description: Relaxed restaurant with pub fare just north of Llangollen.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Bala Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own lunch overlooking the water.

stops.title: Mountain Biking - MinorTaur
stops.description: Enjoy a moderate mountain biking trail at Coed y Brenin Forest Park.

wetAlt.title: Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore the visitor center and enjoy the cafe.

budgetAlt.title: Walking Trails at Coed y Brenin
budgetAlt.description: Explore the numerous walking trails suitable for all fitness levels.

stops.title: Preseli Venture Eco Lodge
stops.description: Eco-friendly lodge near St Davids, ideal for outdoor enthusiasts.

budgetAlt.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Camping near St Davids, with stunning coastal views.

stops.title: Coasteering Classic
stops.description: Explore the Pembrokeshire coastline with TYF Adventure, combining swimming, climbing, and jumping.

wetAlt.title: St Davids Cathedral
wetAlt.description: Visit the historic St Davids Cathedral, a beautiful example of medieval architecture.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal Walk
budgetAlt.description: Hike a section of the Pembrokeshire Coast Path.

stops.title: The Bishops
stops.description: Coastal restaurant offering classic cuisine, just outside of St. Davids.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic Lunch
budgetAlt.description: Pack a lunch to enjoy at Whitesands Beach.

stops.title: Surfing Lesson
stops.description: Learn to surf at Whitesands Beach with TYF Adventure.

wetAlt.title: Oriel y Parc Gallery and Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore local art and learn about the Pembrokeshire Coast National Park.

budgetAlt.title: Swim at Whitesands Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy swimming and relaxing at the beach.

stops.title: Pen y Fan Hike
stops.description: Hike to the summit of Pen y Fan, the highest peak in South Wales.

wetAlt.title: Brecon Mountain Railway
wetAlt.description: Enjoy a steam train ride through the Brecon Beacons.

budgetAlt.title: Pontsticill Reservoir Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around the Pontsticill Reservoir.

stops.title: The Old Ford Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub in the Brecon Beacons.

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch at the top of Pen y Fan.

stops.title: Waterfall Country
stops.description: Explore the stunning waterfalls in the southern Brecon Beacons, including Sgwd yr Eira.

wetAlt.title: National Showcaves Centre
wetAlt.description: Visit the National Showcaves Centre and explore the fascinating caves.

budgetAlt.title: Elidir Trail
budgetAlt.description: Walk along a gentle scenic trail, alongside a gushing river with waterfalls.

stops.title: Gower Peninsula Coastal Walk
stops.description: Explore the stunning Gower Peninsula coastline with a beautiful walk.

wetAlt.title: National Waterfront Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore the industrial and maritime history of Wales at the National Waterfront Museum.

budgetAlt.title: Swansea Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk or swim at Swansea Beach.

stops.title: The King Arthur Hotel
stops.description: An award-winning hotel with hearty and locally-sourced meals.

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch overlooking Three Cliffs Bay.

stops.title: Three Cliffs Bay
stops.description: Relax on this sandy beach and hike the surrounding area.

wetAlt.title: Mumbles Pier and Swansea
wetAlt.description: Enjoy the attractions, arcades and shops in Swansea.

budgetAlt.title: Oxwich Bay
budgetAlt.description: Relax and unwind at Oxwich Bay.

stops.title: Bike Park Wales
stops.description: Enjoy downhill mountain biking at Bike Park Wales.

wetAlt.title: Big Pit National Coal Museum
wetAlt.description: Delve into the world of Welsh mining at the Big Pit National Coal Museum.

budgetAlt.title: Taff Trail
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the scenic Taff Trail

stops.title: The Rock Inn

stops.title: Brecon Beacons Stargazing

wetAlt.title: Brecon Cathedral

budgetAlt.title: Llangorse Lake

budgetAlt.title: Roath Park
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the local Roath Park

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Welsh weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Be prepared for rain and wind, especially in the mountains. Check the forecast before you go and pack accordingly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially during peak season and around popular tourist destinations. Allow extra time for travel, especially on weekends and bank holidays. Parking can be limited and expensive in some areas.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for popular activities like zip-lining and coasteering, especially during peak season. Accommodation should also be booked well in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for this trip, as it involves hiking, mountain biking, and other outdoor activities. Be prepared for some challenging terrain.
